str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A companion, comrade, friend. From etes; a comrade.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To act unjustly towards, injure, harm. From adikos; to be unjust, i.e. do wrong.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To agree with, harmonize with, agree together. From sumphonos; to be harmonious, i.e. to accord or stipulate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A denarius, a small Roman silver coin. Of Latin origin; a denarius.
